headline: Trump-supporting tech billionaire quits Facebook to focus on politics
author: Giulia Bottaro
sentences: However, many industry observers deemed his role at the company controversial due to his political affiliations, especially as the social media owner has been criticised for the handling of misinformation on his platforms.
The Wall Street Journal previously reported that Mr Thiel had lobbied Mr Zuckerberg to keep running political advertising without fact-checking ahead of the 2020 election.
American tech billionaire Peter Thiel plans to leave Facebook’s board in a sign that he will turn his attention to helping Donald Trump get re-elected to the White House.
Mr Thiel, the PayPal co-founder, has announced he will not stand for re-election as a director of Meta, Facebook’s parent company, after nearly two decades as an adviser.
The Financial Times reported that Mr Thiel, a prominent Trump supporter, is looking to focus on “political endeavours” and “avoid that being a distraction for Facebook”.
In 2016, Mr Zuckerberg defended Mr Thiel after it emerged he had donated $1.25m to Mr Trump’s presidential campaign, saying that his presence helped “diversity”.
